result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas P Ciesielczyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
- Cooperate with agent.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: -Denying Motion For IID Exemption; Received, filed and signed by the Court on January 23, 2017. Copies distributed to parties.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. spc
Defendant's affidavit in support of motion for IID exemption, filed by Atty. John E. Dobogai III.
Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Drug Abuse Correctional Center Attn. Stephanie P.O.Box 36 Winnebago, WI 54985-0036

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 28 Judge Sanders..
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
11/2/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Thomas P Ciesielczyk in court with attorney John E Dobogai.  Defendant Thomas P Ciesielczyk in custody.   Nathaniel Stephenson under the student practice rule under the supervision of Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 6 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant to pay a forfeiture in the amount of $600 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances 
 -Defendant's driving privileges revoked for 30 months
-Ignition interlock for 24 months

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

BAIL TO BE RETURNED TO PERSON WHO POSTED AND NOT TO BE USED FOR PAYMENT OF FORFEITURE, COURT COSTS, FEES AND ASSESSMENTS

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet
Filed, various letters used for sentencing purposes

Scheduling conference held off the record. Defense requested plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report received and filed.

Defendant Thomas P Ciesielczyk in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Ronald Dague for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Report dated 5/4/15.
